attributes.action: Make it possible for any baby to have a birth and death certificate after labour
attributes.additional_details:
The current law in England and Wales is that in order to file a birth and death certificate the child must be born after 24 weeks of pregnancy.

The NHS currently offer a hospital-based commemorative certification, however this is not a legal document or proof of life and death. 

No matter the week of pregnancy any parents of a laboured birth should have the option to file for a birth and death certificate.
attributes.background: Having gone through an early labour at 21 weeks and giving birth to a beautiful baby girl, who sadly died seconds after birth, I was heartbroken to realise that her short life would not be recognised legally on this earth with a birth and death certificate. This option should be available to parents
